content: Hello! I found your article really compelling. I definitely agree with every point you raised. I graduated two years ago, and as my final project in university I had the opportunity to work on a redesign concept — it was for a live brief given to me by Transport for London, so it was very real and gave me my first stint in the design industry. I was getting feedback from the UX director at TfL, he was mentoring me throughout the whole thing. I spent months researching every problem, criticism from users/customers of the interface I was redesigning and was able to solve every problem I highlighted. Your article reminded me of my first ‘work experience’. I’ve always been taught that graphic design is a ‘problem-solving’ technique, it isn’t about making things look pretty. It’s saddening that so many people forget that sometimes.
